children.name: to provide money for sb else to live on
provide for
children.definition: to provide money for your family to live on:
examples: cấp dưỡng cho, chu cấp cho
▪ When she was unemployed it was very difficult to provide for her children.
▪ A life insurance policy enables you to provide for your family after your death.
well provided for
cấp dưỡngtốt cho
▪ He left his family well-provided for.

children.name: support
children.definition: to provide enough money for someone to pay for all the things they need, especially if you do thisby working:
examples: cấp dưỡng
▪ He has a wife and two children to support.
▪ A lot of people can barely earn enough to support themselves, let alone their families.
▪ My parents didn’t have to support me when I was at college because I received a grant.
supportverb[ T ]PROVIDE ủng hộ
to give a person the money they need in order to buy food and clothes and pay for somewhere to live
_He has a wife and four children to support.

children.name: pay maintenance
children.definition: British to pay aregularamount of money to the person you used to bemarriedto, especially to supportchildrenof yours that you no longer live with:

children.name: chi tiền cấp dưỡng
examples: ▪ Maintenance will be paid until the child reaches 18 or leaves full-time education.

children.name: pay child support
children.definition: to pay aregularamount of money to help supportchildrenof yours that you no longer live with:

children.name: cấp dưỡng
examples: ▪ He had been paying child support for his two children since 1985.

children.name: pay alimony
children.definition: to pay a regular amount of money to the person you used to be married to:

children.name: cấp dưỡng
examples: ▪ The judge ordered McFadden to pay alimony of $2,400 a month.

children.name: support
children.definition: nounMONEY tiềnủng hộ

children.name: an amount of money that is paid
payment
children.definition: an amount of money that you pay for something, especially when it isonly one partof thetotalamountyou have to pay:
examples: số tiền trả
▪ Your first payment is due on July 16th.
mortgage/car/credit card etc payment
Tiền thanh toán thế chấp / xe / thẻ tín dụng vv
▪ The family spends about $1,800 a month on their mortgage payments.
make a payment
chi trả
▪ He makes monthly payments into his ex-wife’s bank account.
payment of
khoản thanh toán
▪ They have a monthly car payment of £220.
paymentnounsố tiền trả;
[ C or U ] an amount of money paid
_Usually we ask for payment on receipt of the goods.
_We need a deposit of £165 followed by twelve monthly payments of £60.
_When is the first paymentdue?

children.name: instalment
children.definition: British /installmentAmerican   aregularpayment you make to pay back money that you haveborrowedor to pay for things that you have alreadyreceived:
examples: tiền trả mỗi lần ( chia thành nhiều lần trả )
▪ To avoid penalties, pay the installments by the December 10 and April 10 dates.
instalment of £250/$1000 etc
tiền trả mỗi lần£250/$1000...
▪ I borrowed $2000, which was to be paid back in monthly installments of $250.
in instalments
nhiều lần trả
▪ You can pay me in instalments if you can’t afford to give me all the money back in one go.

children.name: deposit /down payment X
children.definition: deposit/down payment partof the cost of something that you paybefore you get it,so that it will not be sold to anyone else and so that the seller is certain that you will buy it:
examples: tiền đặt cọc
▪ Most stores ask for a small deposit if they are to keep goods for you.
$20/£5 etc deposit
tiền đặt cọc$20/£5...
▪ Yes, we have plenty of rooms available, but you’ll have to pay a $20 deposit.
deposit/down payment on
tiền đặt cọccho
▪ She’s paid the deposit on a new bed.
leave a deposit
trả tiền đặt cọc
▪ Would you mind leaving a deposit? You can collect the picture when it’s ready next week.

children.name: down payment
children.definition: thefirstamount of money that you pay for somethingexpensive, which you will continue to pay for over a long period of time:
examples: tiền trả trước lần đầu tiên ( chia thành nhiều lần trả )
▪ For a 40 percent down payment on a new car, the company will arrange a no-interest loan.
make a down payment on something
trả trước lần đầucho cái gì đó
▪ We almost have enough to make a down payment on the house.

children.name: to buy sth and pay for it later
get/buy sth on credit
children.definition: get/buy something on credit  to buy something and pay for it later, usually by making smallregularpayments:
examples: Mua chịu ( trả dần )
▪Most people have to make major purchases on credit.
▪ In 2001, 56% of new cars were bought on credit.
creditnounMONEY
[ U ] a method of paying for goods or services at a later time, usually paying interest as well as the original money
_They decided to buy the caroncredit.
_The shop was offering six months'(interest-free)creditonelectrical goods.

children.name: put sth on the slate
children.definition: put something on the slate  to receive goods or services, especially in small shops or places where you know the owner, and agree to pay for them at a later time:

children.name: ghi nợ số tiền mua cái gì
examples: ▪ Can I put it on the slate, and I’ll pay at the end of the week?

children.name: pay
children.definition: to give money in exchange for goods or services:
examples: trả tiền( cho cái gì )
▪ Several fans tried to get in without paying.
▪ Please pay at the desk.
▪ I need £4.50 to pay the window cleaner.
pay for
trả tiềncho
▪ Have you paid for the tickets?
pay £20/$40 etc for something
trả £20/$40cho
▪ She paid $5,000 for three nights in a hotel in New York City.
pay a bill/rent/tax etc
Thanh toán hóa đơn / tiền thuê / thuế vv
▪ Tom paid his bill at the cashier’s desk.
▪ There was no point in paying rent on an empty apartment for two months.
pay cashpay using coins, notes etc
thanh toán tiền mặt
▪ They don’t have health insurance, so they have to pay cash for doctor’s visits.
pay by cheque/credit card etc
Thanh toán bằng séc / thẻ tín dụng vv
▪ Pay by credit card at least ten days before departure.
pay verbpaid,paidBUY
[ I or T ] to give money to someone for something you want to buy or for services provided
_How much did you payforthe tickets?
_I pay my taxes.
_Will you pay these chequesinto(US usuallydepositthese checksin) my account for me?
_[ + two objects ]I'll pay you the fiverbacktomorrow.
_I paid the driver(in/with)cash.
_Would you prefer to paywith/bycash, cheque or credit card?
_[ + object + to infinitive ]I think we'll need to pay a buildertotake this wall down.
_Did Linda pay youforlookingafter her cats while she was away?
_I paid(out)a lot of money to get the washing machine fixed and it still doesn't work!

children.name: meet the cost of U
children.definition: meet the cost of  if a company or organizationmeets the cost of something,it pays for it for someone else, especially when they do not have a legal duty to do this:
examples: tình nguyện chi trả cho...
▪ We will meet the cost of any expenses you may incur when travelling to your interview.
meet the cost of of doing something
tình nguyện chi trả chocái gì đó
▪ A local firm has agreed to meet the cost of sending ten lucky prize-winners on a dream holiday.

children.name: foot the bill
children.definition: to pay for something for someone else, especially when you donot want toor do not think that you should:
examples: trả hóa đơn ( không muốn )
▪ It will be, as usual, the taxpayer who will be footing the bill.
foot the bill for
trả hóa đơn
▪ The program asks businesses to foot the bill for daily newspapers in the classroom.

children.name: fork out/shell out
children.definition: to paya lot of moneyforsomething because you have to and not because you want to, especially for something you need:
examples: chi, trả
▪ The policy affects how much we will have to shell out at the petrol station.
fork out £100/$10,000/a lot of money etc
chi, trả£100/$10,000/nhiều tiền...
▪ He had to fork out £500 to get his car fixed.
▪ Fans are having to shell out roughly $65 per seat for football games.
fork out £100/$20,000/a lot of money etc on somebody/something
chi, trả£100/$10,000/nhiều tiền... cho ai đó/cái gì đó
▪ From the time you enroll them in nursery school, you’re forking out a fortune on the kids.
fork out/shell out for
chi, trảcho
▪ $13 seems like a lot of money to shell out for a bottle of wine.

children.name: cough up
children.definition: to pay money for something, especially money that you owe or that someone has persuaded you to pay:

children.name: trả
examples: ▪ You owe me twenty pounds. Come on, cough up!

children.name: cough up £3/$100/a few pence etc
examples: trả£3/$100/1 vài xu ...
▪ You have to cough up $2 just to get into the park.

children.name: stump up
children.definition: British informal to pay for something, usually when someone else thinks you should: xì tiền
examples: ▪ His dad wouldn’t stump up for a new bike.

children.name: stump up £50/$200/a lot of money etc
examples: xìra£50/$200/nhiều tiền...
▪ Everybody in the office stumped up a few pounds for his leaving present.

children.name: to have enough money to pay for sth
can afford
children.definition: if you can afford something, you have enough money to pay for it:
examples: có khả năng chi trả cho
▪ I’d love to visit Australia, but I just can’t afford it.
▪ I had to move because I couldn’t afford the rent any more.
can afford to do something
có khả năng chi trả chocái gì đó
▪ How can you afford to eat in restaurants all the time?
▪ He’s finally earning more, so he can afford to have a holiday this year.
can afford
to be able to buy or do something because you have enough money or time
_I don't know how he can afford a new car on his salary.
_Few people are able to afford cars like that.
_She couldn't afford the time off work to see him.
_[ + to infinitive ]I can't affordtobuy a house.

children.name: be able to pay A1
children.definition: be able to pay  to have enough money to pay for something such as a tax or a bill: có khả năng chi trả
examples: ▪ They say they will have all the money on Friday, but I don’t think they’ll be able to pay.
▪ Some people just aren’t able to pay the tax.
be able to pay for
có khả năng chi trả cho
▪ Many people use credit as a way of buying goods they are not able to pay for.

children.name: to pay sb to do sth
pay
children.definition: to pay someone forwork:
examples: trả
▪ How much do they pay you?
pay somebody for (doing) something
trả cho ai đó để làm cái gì đó
▪ They still haven’t paid her for the work she did last year.
▪ Did she pay you for taking care of her kids?
be/get paid
được trả
▪ We get paid at the end of every month.
pay somebody £100/$200 etc
▪ Ziedler was ready to pay her $2000 a week.
pay somebody to do something
trả ai đó để làm cái gì đó
▪ If you pay someone to work in your house, you have to pay Social Security taxes on the wages.
pay well/badly
trả lương tốt/tệ
▪ Jobs in areas that use mathematical skills, such as computer programming, tend to pay well.
paid[adjective]
được chi trả
▪ Many Britons receive four or five weeks of paid holiday a year.
well/highly paidpaid a lot
trả lương cao
▪ He has a very well-paid job in finance.
▪ a highly paid executive
badly paidnot paid much
trả lương tệ
▪ Most badly paid jobs are done by women.
▪ The job is exhausting and badly paid.
payverbpaid,paidWORK(pay somebody; pay for something; pay something to somebody / for something) trả (tiền lương...) nộp; thanh toán
[ I or T ] to give money to someone for work which they have done
_The company pays £220 a weekforpeople to act as couriers.
_Accountancy may be boring but at least it payswell.
_Most of these women are verypoorlypaid and work in terrible conditions.

children.name: make it worth sb’s while U
children.definition: make it worth somebody’s while  informal if you tell someone you willmake it worth their while, you mean you will give them money if they agree to do something for you, especially something dishonest or not convenient:

children.name: trả công ai đó xứng đáng
examples: ▪ I didn’t want to lend Terry my car, but he said he’d make it worth my while.
▪ The basketball federation in Kuwait offered him a coaching job, and made it worth his while.

children.name: to pay for sth before you receive it
pay in advance B1
children.definition: pay in advanceto pay for something before you receive it:

children.name: trả trước
examples: ▪ Customs fees are paid in advance as part of your airline ticket.
▪ Don’t pay cash in advance for any service.

children.name: up front
children.definition: if you pay for something up front, youpay or partly payfor it before you receive it, especially in order toshowthe person you are paying that they cantrustyou:

children.name: ( trả, thanh toán ) trước
examples: ▪ I paid the builts £100 up front and will give them the rest when the job’s finished.
▪ We’ve had so many unpaid bills that we’ve started to demand payment up front.

children.name: put a down payment on
children.definition: make/  to pay part of the cost of somethingexpensive, especially a home or car, and agree to pay the rest at a later time:

children.name: trả tiền trước cho cái gì
examples: ▪ We saved enough money to make a down payment on a house.
▪ He borrowed money from his family to put a down payment on a truck.

children.name: put a deposit on
children.definition: put/make/pay a deposit on  to pay part of the cost of something before you buy it, especially so that no one else can buy it instead of you:
examples: đặt cọc trước (tránh bị người khác mua trước )
▪ We’ve put a deposit on a round-the-world tour.
▪ The Center has helped several poor families pay the deposit on a better apartment.
depositnounMONEY
[ C ] a sum of money which you pay as the first part of the total payment for something
_The shop assistant says if Ileave£10asa deposit, they'll keep the dress for me.
_Wepaid/puta depositof£10 000onthe house, and paid the balance four weeks later.

children.name: put $100 down on
children.definition: put $100/£100 etc down onto pay money towards the cost of something so that you can be sure it will be sold to you:
examples: đặt cọc ...
▪ I’ve put £200 down on a new bedroom carpet.
▪ Greg’s parents are going to give us some money to put down on a car.

children.name: put sth on layaway
children.definition: put/buy something on layawayAmerican to pay part of the money for something you buyat a store, such as a piece of clothing or a gift, so that the store keeps it for you until you can pay the rest:

children.name: đặt cọc cái gì
examples: ▪ I’d like to put this sweater on layaway, please.

children.name: when several people give some of the total money needed
make a contribution
children.definition: to give an amount of money that when added to money given by other people, can be used to pay for something useful:
examples: đóng góp, góp phần[cụm động từ]
▪ If we all make a contribution, we’ll be able to get him something really nice.
Nếu chúng ta đều đóng góp một phần, chúng ta sẽ có thể cho anh ấy một thứ thật tốt.
make a contribution to/towards
đóng góp, góp phần vào
▪ Several local businesses have made contributions towards our new school bus.
Nhiều doanh nghiệp địa phương đã đóng góp cho chiếc xe buýt mới của trường ta.

children.name: contribute
children.definition: to give some of the money that is needed to pay for something:
examples: đóng góp, góp phần[nội động từ] cho đi một khoản tiền trong tổng số tiền cần phải trả cho cái gì đó
contribute to
góp phần vào
▪ I’d like to thank all of you who contributed to the hospital appeal.
Tôi muốn cảm ơn tất cả các bạn những người đã đóng góp cho lời yêu cầu được giúp đỡ của bệnh viện
contribute something to/towards something
đóng góp cái gì đó vào cái khác
▪ My parents said they would contribute something towards the cost of my driving lessons.
Bố mẹ tôi nói rằng họ sẽ đóng góp thứ gì đó vào tiền học phí khóa học lái xe của tôi.

children.name: have a collection
children.definition: to collect money from each of the people in a group, especially in order to buy something for someone:
examples: mở một cuộc quyên góp[cụm động từ] thu thập một số tiền từ từng người trong một tổ chức, nhất là để mua cái gì cho người nào đó
▪ They had a collection at the bar and they raised over $80.
Họ đã mở một buổi quyên góp ở quán rượu và họ thu được hơn 80 đô la Mỹ.
have a collection for
mở một cuộc quyên góp cho
▪ We’re having a collection for Jane’s birthday present.
Chúng ta sẽ mở một buổi góp tiền để mua quà sinh nhật cho Jane.

children.name: chip in
children.definition: if everyone in a groupchips in an amount of money, they each give an amount so that they can pay for something together:
examples: góp vốn, góp tiền
▪ We all chipped in to pay for the food and wine.
Tất cả chúng tôi đều đã góp tiền để chi trả cho thức ăn và rượu.
▪ When Mona retired, all her co-workers chipped in and bought her a lovely dinner service.
Khi Mona nghỉ hưu, tất cả đồng nghiệp của cô ấy sẽ góp tiền để mua cho cô ấy một buổi tối được phục vụ.
chip in with
góp vốn, góp tiền với (số tiền)
▪ Electronics firm Compol chipped in with over $20,000.
Công ty điện tử Compol đã góp vốn hơn 20000 đô la Mỹ.
chip(sth)inphrasal verb[ M ]informal
to give some money when several people are giving money to pay for something together
_They all chipped in fifty pounds and bought their mother a trip toGreece.

children.name: pay/give towards
children.definition: British /givetowardsomethingAmerican   to give part of the money needed to pay for something:
examples: chi trả/tặng vàotừ Anh /tặng vào cái gì đó[cụm động từ] tặng một phần số tiền cần có để chi trả cho cái gì đó.
pay/give something towards something
▪ I don’t mind paying something towards Samantha’s wedding present.
Tôi không ngại để tặng cái gì đó cho quà cưới của Samantha.
▪ She feels it’s partly her fault the TV’s broken, so she’s ready to pay $50 toward a new one.
Cô ấy cảm thấy một phần cũng do lỗi của cô ấy làm cái ti vi bị hư, nên cô ấy sẵn sàng trả 50 đô la cho cái ti vi mới.
pay/give towards something
trả/tặng vào cái gì đó
▪ Although students receive government grants, parents are still expected to pay towards living costs.
Mặc dù học sinh nhận được trợ cấp chính phủ, phụ huynh vẫn bị yêu cầu chi trả phí sinh hoạt

children.name: have a whip-round
children.definition: British informal if a group of people have a whip-round, everyone in the group immediately gives some money in order to buy something with the total amount that is collected:

children.name: to pay money to sb because they have suffered an injury, loss, damage etc
compensate
examples: bồi thường
▪ People are entitled to be compensated fully whenever they are injure by others’ carelessness.
compensate for something
bồi thườngcho cái gì đó
▪ No amount of money can compensate for my father’s death.
compensate somebody for something
bồi thườngcho ai đó cái gì đó
▪ The workers have still not been compensated for their loss of wages.
compensateverbPAY MONEYđền bù; bồi thường
[ T ] to pay someone money in exchange for something that has been lost or damaged or for some problem
_Victims of the crash will be compensatedfortheir injuries.

children.name: compensation
children.definition: money that someone pays you because they have caused you harm, loss, or damage to your property:
examples: tiền bồi thường
▪ The government cannot take private property for public use without compensation.
pay somebody compensation
trả ai đótiền bồi thường
▪ His employers paid him $5000 compensation for his broken leg.
compensation for
bồi thường cho
▪ See if you can get some compensation from the airline for your lost baggage.

children.name: damages
children.definition: money that a law court orders someone to pay to you because they have caused you harm:
examples: tiền bồi thường thiệt hại
pay somebody damages
trả ai đótiền bồi thườngthiệt hại
▪ Survivors of the air crash were paid $10000 each in damages.
award somebody damages: agree that damages should be paid
bồi thườngthiệt hại cho ai đó
▪ Damages of £2500 were awarded by the court. : ..£2500 tiền bồi thường thiệt hại được quyết định phạt bởi tòa án

children.name: to provide money to help sb do sth
subsidize
children.definition: alsosubsidiseBritish   if agovernmentor otherorganizationsubsidizes something, it pays part of the cost:

children.name: trợ cấp
examples: ▪ Many companies subsidize meals for their workers.

children.name: ▪ a government-subsidized health service
examples: ▪ The city council subsidizes the local orchestra.

children.name: sponsor
children.definition: if a companysponsors somethingsuch as sports event, a theatre, or an art show, it provides some of the money that is needed, often as a form of advertising:
examples: tài trợ, bảo trợ
▪ The new league will be sponsored by Pepsi Cola.
▪ The bank is sponsoring an art exhibition.
sponsor[countable noun]nhà tài trợ
▪ Sponsors’ corporate logos are placed on the boards surrounding the field.
sponsorverb[ T ] đỡ đầu, bảo trợ
to support a person, organization or activity by giving money,encouragement or other help
_The team is sponsored by JVC, so the players wear the letters JVC on their shirts.
_Eva said she was doing a ten-mile walk for charity and asked if I'd sponsor herfor£1 a mile.

children.name: fund
children.definition: to provide all the money needed to pay for something, especially an important or expensive plan: cấp tiền cho, tài trợ
examples: ▪ Both schools and industry will be involved in funding the new training projects.
▪ a charity funded by private donations
▪ The state should fund the arts for the benefit of us all.
fundverb[ T ]
to provide the money to pay for an event, activity or organization
_The company has agreed to fund my trip toAustralia.
_The new college is being privately funded (= money for it is not being provided from taxes) .

children.name: bankroll
children.definition: to provide the money for something such as a business or a plan: cung cấp vốn cho
examples: ▪ The competition is being bankrolled by a New York businessman and computer enthusiast.

children.name: ▪ Ed Bass, a millionaire from Texas, bankrolled the Biosphere project
underwrite
children.definition: to provide the money needed for something and agree to take responsibility and pay any debts if it fails: cam kết tài trợ
examples: ▪ The British government has agreed to underwrite the project with a grant of £5 million.
▪ The venture was underwritten by several companies.

children.name: put money into U
children.definition: put money into  to provide some of the money needed to start or continue in business, hoping that you will get more money back if the business is successful:

children.name: đổ vốn vào
examples: ▪ Small investors and large companies have both put money into the exhibition.
▪ He put all his money into a dotcom company that later failed.

children.name: finance /back
children.definition: finance/back  to provide the money needed to pay for something, especially by doing something to earn or collect that money: bỏ vốn cho
examples: ▪ The government uses money from taxes to finance higher education.
▪ She gave swimming lessons to finance her stay in Australia.
▪ It’s a great show, but he can’t find anyone to back it.
▪ The bank is eager to back business ideas by local people.
financeverb[ T ]
to provide the money needed for something to happen
_The local authority has refused to finance the scheme.

children.name: pour money into U
children.definition: pour money into  to provide a lot of money over a period of time to pay for something, especially something that will later be unsuccessful:

children.name: đổ tiền vào
examples: ▪ Many biotech companies are not yet profitable, as they continue to pour money into research and trials.

children.name: throw money at U
children.definition: throw money at  to provide a lot of money for something, especially government money - use this when you donot thinkthat this is the best way of solving a problem or improving a situation:

children.name: ném tiền vào
examples: ▪ The way to solve the education crisis is not necessarily to throw money at it.
▪ The Republicans see him as a liberal whose only solution to the nation’s problems was to throw money at them.

children.name: sponsorship
children.definition: noun
examples: _The orchestra receives £2 million a yearinsponsorship from companies.

children.name: sponsor
children.definition: noun
examples: _All the major theatres now have sponsors, especiallyforhigh-cost productions.

children.name: change
children.definition: nounMONEY tiền thối

children.name: for
children.definition: prepositionPAYMENT

children.name: (getting) in exchange
examples: _How much did you pay for your glasses?
_I've sponsored her £1 for every mile that she runs.
_She sold the house for quite a lot of money.
_They've said they'll repair my car for £300.

children.name: give
children.definition: verbgave,givenPROVIDE

children.name: support
children.definition: verbPROVIDE

children.name: If you support an activity or a habit, you provide the money needed to pay for it
examples: _The drug company is supporting cancer research.
_I don't know how they manage to support their expensive lifestyle.
_Some drug addicts turn to crime in order to support their habit.

children.name: cover
children.definition: verbBE ENOUGH đủ để bù đắp lại được, đủ để trả

children.name: payable
children.definition: adjectivephải trả

children.name: If achequeis payable to a person or an organization, the money will be paid to them because their name is written on it
examples: _Please make your cheque payable to WWF.

children.name: payable
children.definition: adjectivecó thể trả;phải trả

children.name: that should be paid
examples: _Interest payments are payable monthly.

children.name: to pay extra money to thank sb
tip
children.definition: to pay a waiter, taxi driver etc a little extra money:
examples: ▪ It’s usual to tip about 15% in restaurants. tipping [uncountable noun]
▪ A service charge is included on the bill, so tipping isn’t necessary.

children.name: cho tiền quà, bo
examples: ▪ Did you tip the waiter?

children.name: tip
children.definition: a small amount of money that you give someone such as a waiter or taxi-driver in addition to the ordinary payment:
examples: tiền bo
▪ The boy carried my suitcases up to my room and then stood waiting for a tip.
▪ A 15% tip is considered usual if the service was good.
leave a tip
để lại tiền bo
▪ We finished our lunch and left a tip on the table for the waiter.
